TopicTitle: Do you have a screenshot that makes you laugh every time?

Articles.Content:
I've been lurking for a while, and now I felt the need to share a few pics. A new race of Kerbals:

Spoiler

![2C9351862BE361AB44219F0612F4CC00E32AF213](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/493527550101243219/2C9351862BE361AB44219F0612F4CC00E32AF213/)![2A0E069A02E14B36D14FB81DE5B7B164C58BA68B](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/493527550101239712/2A0E069A02E14B36D14FB81DE5B7B164C58BA68B/)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-08-07T15:00:43Z" title="08/07/2016 03:00  PM" data-short="7 yr">August 7, 2016</time> by Bogen**

Jeb is truly a insane lunatic 

Spoiler

![orFJWo5.png](http://i.imgur.com/orFJWo5.png)

My scientist is struck with the palsy (or a rover wheel).

![e0MKESll.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/e0MKESll.jpg)

Like a true Stephen Hawking, he's still able to move around and use his jetpack though.

![cTWZ0vsl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/cTWZ0vsl.jpg)

I hope it's the palsy, or that arm is in real trouble.

![ZmACN06l.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ZmACN06l.jpg)

Unlike brave Stephen though, he was just fine after a therapeutic 1 second stay inside the crew cabin.

For me, it was The Truckplane. Even my non-kerballing friends remember it, because I shared pictures. I guess this is a couple of screenshots, but still...

... it made sense at the time.

![855A905AF797CC83E3D8977B666A98F5DA80C419](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/469802550812443706/855A905AF797CC83E3D8977B666A98F5DA80C419/)

![BAC4C67116149B4F86813ECD99FFCBA30F1165F4](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/469802550812444806/BAC4C67116149B4F86813ECD99FFCBA30F1165F4/)

![0464E48E5F54C079248A725562E872C40B9D3458](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/469802550812446332/0464E48E5F54C079248A725562E872C40B9D3458/)

![26B9C9B8DD9B165DB71D30F2EEFECA25AA6BA8CB](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/469802550812447227/26B9C9B8DD9B165DB71D30F2EEFECA25AA6BA8CB/)

It totaly reminds me of the "Eagle 5" from *SpaceBalls*

![latest (540×303)](http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/spaceballs/images/a/a6/Spaceballs-eagle5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120107110408)

Apparently Val has some trouble standing on the exact tip of the Mun's north pole...

![IZj4ZQX.png](http://i.imgur.com/IZj4ZQX.png)

![7cFByU9.png](http://i.imgur.com/7cFByU9.png)

at least he died amused.![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Here, from a mission to the Mun some two years ago. The original caption reads:

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> Mission failure  
> 
> Bill Kerman fell off the top of the ship while attempting a status report on our science instruments  
> 
> Bob Kerman is lying on his back and staring at the stars, muttering to himself
> 

![1781975_703056716421902_2276807952024269](https://scontent-sit4-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/1781975_703056716421902_2276807952024269211_n.jpg?oh=7d6a5651d9900b0619915b6129b4df7a&oe=585D0D34)

Iv'e made an emergency landing near a strange black alien pyramid:

![mP4PQUv.png](http://i.imgur.com/mP4PQUv.png)

Finally it was a big black mass with strange properties.

![9yZpUeU.png](http://i.imgur.com/9yZpUeU.png)

> 
> Patcan Kerman performing a 3.2km/s interplanetary aerobrake while riding an asteroid captured by the Buran 11F35 Kerbal 1.

>

>

> [![knLo23p.png](http://i.imgur.com/knLo23p.png)](http://i.imgur.com/knLo23p.png "Enlarge image")

Now I finally know what your user image is a picture of.  I had been wondering what that was behind your shuttle.

Sorry i know not very mature for someone of advancing years but it still amuses me after several months..

![uLEvMD8.png](http://i.imgur.com/uLEvMD8.png)

![V2XmnwY.png](http://i.imgur.com/V2XmnwY.png)

This one

When the space madness takes hold, I'm not sure I want to share a cabin with Bob.

![0DPZjhi.png](http://i.imgur.com/0DPZjhi.png)

First-

This is the best Thread ever in this forum and should be always on top.

Second-

this thread have the pure KSP spirit in it.  Hours of test, failures stress and work are replaced with a laugh of happiness.

Third-

the thread makes all the people who takes (wrongly in my personal opinion) the game too seriously apart (and that's a good thing). Calculations, <abbr title="Mechjeb (mod)">MJ</abbr>, hours of planning, cheats, "amazing projects" are nothing against the real happening of the fun (or the kraken).

Fourth-

thanks to all the KPS community for the shares!

Here's a new one.

![XtCijux.png](http://i.imgur.com/XtCijux.png)

Jeb climbed out of an F-32 Kestrel, jumped off the wing, and got stuck in the missile mounts. Hilarity ensued. 

I like to call this one *Between The Sidewinders*.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-03T19:53:38Z" title="10/03/2016 07:53  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 3, 2016</time> by Mrsupersonic8**

This one isn't mine and isn't actually a screenshot but makes even my girl laugh. Take any frame as a screenshot. The title says that its name is something like "Veloscratchaptor"

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cOf_AvgV3Y0?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Rosarium said:
> 
> 
> Third-
> 
> 
> 
> 
> the thread makes all the people who takes (wrongly in my personal opinion) the game too seriously apart (and that's a good thing). Calculations, <abbr title="Mechjeb (mod)">MJ</abbr>, hours of planning, cheats, "amazing projects" are nothing against the real happening of the fun (or the kraken).
> 

Am I a hypocrite for liking both? I do Serious Business rockets sometimes, and silly glitchy slapstick fun at others. It is amazing to me that a single game can scratch both itches.

> 
> 
> 49 minutes ago, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> Am I a hypocrite for liking both? I do Serious Business rockets sometimes, and silly glitchy slapstick fun at others. It is amazing to me that a single game can scratch both itches.
> 

Nope.  I for one like both as well.  I'm butt-deep designing a ship meant to brachistochrone from Kerbin to Eve and get a probe safely to the surface as fast as possible, which is both serious planning, a lot of math, and also silly fun.  Plus I've at least one craft titled "SPIDERS~!" that dispenses dancing I-beam spiders due to the problems with attaching several of those things to one endpoint.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Ser said:
> 
> 
> This one isn't mine and isn't actually a screenshot but makes even my girl laugh. Take any frame as a screenshot. The title says that its name is something like "Veloscratchaptor"
> 

An opportunity was missed to use the back rocket to make that thing run over water like the lizard it resembles.
